means: （就某事与某人）达成协议，（与某人）商定（某事）(with a person about 或 for a thing)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"使有条理，安排"之意。
means: organize ： 指按计划或需要把人或物安排组织成一个整体。
arrange ： 指按计划、秩序、需要和可能等进行安排。
classify ： 指按照事物类型、质量或是否相似进行分类。
sort ： 通常指根据类型或种类分类或整理选择。

word_mean: 【动】改编，安[重]排，排列(方式)，调整，布置

sentence.Network_cn: 透支的客户每月要缴纳5英镑的费用。

sentence.Network_en: I will arrange for someone to take you round.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Old French arangier, from a- (from Latin ad 'to, at') + rangier 'put in order' (see range)

encyclopedia.content: 词义解释 v.（动词）：arranged，arranged，arranged，arranging，arranges 及物动词 (1) To put into a specific order or relation; dispose: 安排：放成有序或相关的（排列）；布置： eg. arrange shoes in a neat row. 把鞋放成整齐的一排 (2) To plan or prepare for: 计划，做准备： eg.arrange a picnic. 准备一次野餐 (3) To bring about an agreement concerning; settle: 解决：就某事达成一致；确定： eg.“It has bee

entry.def: If you arrange an event or meeting, you make plans for it to happen.

example.ex: She arranged an appointment for Friday afternoon at four-fifteen...
example.tran: 她在星期五下午4点15分安排了一次会面。

example.ex: This time it was a friend ringing to try to arrange a fishing trip in Scotland...
example.tran: 这次是一个朋友打来电话，想组织一次到苏格兰的钓鱼旅行。

entry.def: If you arrange with someone to do something, you make plans with them to do it.

example.ex: I've arranged to see him on Friday morning...
example.tran: 我已安排好星期五上午见他。

example.ex: It was arranged that the party would gather for lunch in the Royal Garden Hotel...
example.tran: 已经和这一行人说好将在皇家花园宾馆吃午餐。

entry.def: If you arrange something for someone, you make it possible for them to have it or to do it.

example.ex: I will arrange for someone to take you round...
The hotel manager will arrange for a babysitter...
example.tran: 宾馆经理会安排人照看婴儿。

entry.def: If you arrange things somewhere, you place them in a particular position, usually in order to make them look attractive or tidy.

example.ex: When she has a little spare time she enjoys arranging dried flowers...
example.tran: 她稍有空闲便喜欢摆弄干花。

example.ex: He started to arrange the books in piles...

entry.def: If a piece of music is arranged by someone, it is changed or adapted so that it is suitable for particular instruments or voices, or for a particular performance.

example.ex: The songs were arranged by another well-known bass player, Ron Carter.
example.tran: 另一位著名的低音提琴演奏家罗恩·卡特改编了这些歌曲。

means.word_mean: 1. put into a proper or systematic order;

sentences.sentence: "arrange the books on the shelves in chronological order"
"Can you arrange a meeting with the President?"

means.word_mean: 3. plan, organize, and carry out (an event)
4. set (printed matter) into a specific format;

sentences.sentence: "Format this letter so it can be printed out"

means.word_mean: 6. adapt for performance in a different way;
7. arrange thoughts, ideas, temporal events, etc.;

sentences.sentence: "I put these memories with those of bygone times"

stems_affixes.word_buile: derange[v.使错乱,扰乱,使精神错乱,使发狂]+ed表形容词→adj.疯狂的
arrange[v.安排]+ment表名词→n.整理,排列;安排

mis坏,不好+arrange[v.安排]→v.排错,作不适当的安排
range排列,顺序→n.范围,领域;排列,连续;[山]脉v.排列成行

Sentence.sentence: Doris helped him arrange the furniture.

In those where ties to family and community are strong, lifelong marriages can be promoted by practices such as the cultural prohibition of divorce and arranged marriages that are seen as a contract between two families, not just two individuals.
Arranging the woman's appointment with Mr. Romero.
And if you don't want to do it yourself, head to Aisle 23 or Aisle 35, where a help desk will arrange for an installer.
Arranging a bed for a patient.

sentences.cn: 一切都得到了令人满意的安排。

sentences.en: He began to arrange the flowers in the vase.
sentences.cn: 他开始把花瓶内的花摆好。

means.word_mean: 达成…的协议；解决，调解，调停(纠纷、分歧等)

sentences.en: The two sides arranged the sale of the property.
sentences.cn: 双方达成关于房地产交易的协议。

jushi.english: Be sure to arrange so that we can get there at one o'clock.
jushi.chinese: 一定要想法安排好,使我们能在1点钟到那里。
